controllers.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

controllers.code.description.documentation: Short description of the software (type, purpose)

controllers.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

controllers.code.library[:].description.documentation: Short description of the software (type, purpose)

controllers.code.library[:].parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

controllers.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

controllers.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

controllers.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

controllers.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

controllers.ids_properties.creation_date.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

controllers.ids_properties.homogeneous_t.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

controllers.ids_properties.name.documentation: User-defined name for this IDS occurrence

controllers.ids_properties.occurrence.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

controllers.ids_properties.occurrence_ty.documentation:
Type of data contained in this occurrence
1) reconstruction : Equilibrium reconstruction
2) prediction_fixed : Equilibrium prediction, fixed boundary
3) prediction_free : Equilibrium prediction, free boundary
4) mapping : Used for mapping equilibrium results from one grid type / resolution to another, or for including variables not present in the first set such as the calculation of magnetic field of other derived parameters
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

controllers.ids_properties.plugins.documentation: Information about the plugins used to write/read this IDS. This structure is filled automatically by the Access Layer at GET/PUT time, no need to fill it via a user program.

controllers.ids_properties.plugins.infra.documentation: Plugin infrastructure used to GET the data
Short description of the software (type, purpose)
Plugin infrastructure used to PUT the data
Short description of the software (type, purpose)

controllers.ids_properties.plugins.node.documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which a plugin has been applied

controllers.ids_properties.plugins.node[.documentation: Plugins actually used to read back a node (potentially, multiple plugins can be applied, listed in reverse order of application). This information is filled by the plugin infrastructure during the GET operation.
Short description of the software (type, purpose)
List of the code specific parameters in XML format
Path of the node within the IDS, following the syntax given in the link below. If empty, means the plugin applies to the whole IDS.
Plugins used to PUT a node (potentially, multiple plugins can be applied, if so they are listed by order of application)
Short description of the software (type, purpose)
List of the code specific parameters in XML format
Plugins to be used to read back a node (potentially, multiple plugins can be applied, listed in reverse order of application)
Short description of the software (type, purpose)
List of the code specific parameters in XML format

controllers.ids_properties.provenance.no.documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which the provenance is given. The provenance information applies to the whole structure below the IDS node. For documenting provenance information for the whole IDS, set the size of this array of structure to 1 and leave the child "path" node empty
Path of the node within the IDS, following the syntax given in the link below. If empty, means the provenance information applies to the whole IDS.

List of sources used to import or calculate this node, identified as explained below. In case the node is the result of of a calculation / data processing, the source is an input to the process described in the "code" structure at the root of the IDS. The source can be an IDS (identified by a URI or a persitent identifier, see syntax in the link below) or non-IDS data imported directly from an non-IMAS database (identified by the command used to import the source, or the persistent identifier of the data source). Often data are obtained by a chain of processes, however only the last process input are recorded here. The full chain of provenance has then to be reconstructed recursively from the provenance information contained in the data sources.

controllers.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

controllers.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...). Superseeded by the new provenance structure.

controllers.ids_properties.version_put.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS

controllers.ids_properties.version_put.a.documentation: Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS

controllers.ids_properties.version_put.d.documentation: Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

controllers.linear_controller.documentation: A linear controller, this is rather conventional

controllers.linear_controller[:].control.documentation: One of a known class of controllers

controllers.linear_controller[:].input_n.documentation: Names of the input signals, following the SDN convention

controllers.linear_controller[:].inputs.documentation: Input signals; the timebase is common to inputs and outputs for any particular controller

controllers.linear_controller[:].inputs..documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

controllers.linear_controller[:].output_.documentation: Names of the output signals following the SDN convention

controllers.linear_controller[:].outputs.documentation: Output signals; the timebase is common to inputs and outputs for any particular controller
Index in the error_description list for "data"

controllers.linear_controller[:].pid.d.d.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

controllers.linear_controller[:].pid.i.d.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

controllers.linear_controller[:].pid.p.d.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

controllers.linear_controller[:].pid.tau.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

controllers.linear_controller[:].statesp.documentation: Statespace controller in discrete or continuous time
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Index in the error_description list for "data"
D matrix, normally proper and D=0
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Discrete time sampling interval ; if less than 1e-10, the controller is considered to be expressed in continuous time
Index in the error_description list for "data"

controllers.nonlinear_controller.documentation: A non-linear controller, this is less conventional and will have to be developed

controllers.nonlinear_controller[:].cont.documentation: One of a known class of controllers

controllers.nonlinear_controller[:].inpu.documentation: Names of the input signals, following the SDN convention
Input signals; the timebase is common  to inputs and outputs for any particular controller
Index in the error_description list for "data"

controllers.nonlinear_controller[:].outp.documentation: Output signal names following the SDN convention
Output signals; the timebase is common  to inputs and outputs for any particular controller
Index in the error_description list for "data"
